Articles.Content:
Hello, when i try to start the game, it is not loading (the bar stucks sometimes right at beggining, sometimes in half), but it doesnt feel like it crashed...  (waited for like 10mins), (i7 7700HQ, NVIDIA GeForce 1060)   (already tried to verify files (steam))                        (Sorry for my bad english)

Edited May 3, 2019 by PiGiKiNg

How long have you waited for the game to load?

 My game has the loading bar freeze in the middle but it always loads if you wait for a little while.
It might depend on what computer and operating system

2 hours ago, Seanburg2006 said:

How long have you waited for the game to load?

 My game has the loading bar freeze in the middle but it always loads if you wait for a little while.

I waited like 10min. But it wasnt loading...

7 minutes ago, The Doodling Astronaut said:

It might depend on what computer and operating system 

Win10, nvidia 1060 And i7 7700HQ so i think it is not caused by that

If you are on steam try to verify the game files.

Here is how: https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335

15 hours ago, Boyster said:

If you are on steam try to verify the game files.

Here is how: https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335

Already did, it didnt helped.

Do you have Making History Expansion?

If you have it does it say its installed when you select Kerbal in the game library?(at the DLC window)

Are you Alt+Tab ing while its loading? Sometimes mine crashes when i alt tab before it fully loads.

I know you posted to unmodded but just to make sure, do you have ANY mods or you edited anything inside the game folder?

Other than that and a full clean install maybe someone else can offer help.

 

Edited May 3, 2019 by Boyster

I guess, a log file might be useful in this case. It will show us at which point the loading procedure stops and probably also the reason for it. The output_log.txt is located here: 

%USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\output_log.txt

If you are on a different system, take a look here:

Please upload the log file to a cloud like dropbox, one drive, etc...and share a download link

18 hours ago, Boyster said:

Do you have Making History Expansion?

If you have it does it say its installed when you select Kerbal in the game library?(at the DLC window)

Are you Alt+Tab ing while its loading? Sometimes mine crashes when i alt tab before it fully loads.

I know you posted to unmodded but just to make sure, do you have ANY mods or you edited anything inside the game folder?

Other than that and a full clean install maybe someone else can offer help.

 

No, i do not have making history dlc, i'm sure i do not have any mods installed right Now, and i am not alt-tabbing When loading the game, thank you for suggestions tho.

Edited March 29, 2020 by Guest

56 minutes ago, <noname> said:

It looks like the game is installed on the d drive in a steam directory. Then, it's trying to do stuff on the c: drive for some reason. I don 't know, it it was me, I'd try to copy the "Kerbal Space Program" directory out of the steam directory and put it on the desktop then run the game manually by double clicking the kspx86_64 file. If the game runs, you know you have issues with permissions somewhere.

edit : yeah right here look :

UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path "D:\HRY\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\settings.cfg" is denied.

 

Hi, thank you for your suggestion, When i just copied the game from d: to c: and started it from the c: , it still was not working, then i noticed Windows defender notification about unautorized folder access, i turned off folder access "control" in Windows defender And tried to run the game, it Is working now, even from the d: folder, thank you, have a nice day.

On 5/2/2019 at 2:00 PM, PiGiKiNg said:

Hello, when i try to start the game, it is not loading (the bar stucks sometimes right at beggining, sometimes in half), but it doesnt feel like it crashed...  (waited for like 10mins), (i7 7700HQ, NVIDIA GeForce 1060)   (already tried to verify files (steam))                        (Sorry for my bad english)

THE PROBLEM IS SOLVED, THANK YOU ALL FOR NICE SUGGESTIONS AND YOUR TIME. HAVE A NICE DAY!
